fields_of_interest: Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: HRI is a member of the EU Civil Society Forum on Drugs and the EU civil society forum on HIV/AIDS. We follow EU drugs policy and policy related to HIV/AIDS.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Harm Reduction International is a leading non-governmental organisation working to promote and expand support for harm reduction. 
 
We work to reduce the negative health, social and human rights impacts of drug use and drug policy – such as the increased vulnerability to HIV and hepatitis infection among people who inject drugs – by promoting evidence-based public health policies and practices, and human rights based approaches to drug policy.  
 
We are an influential global source of research, policy/legal analysis and advocacy on drug use, health and human rights issues. 
 
The organisation is an NGO in Special Consultative Status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations.
relevant_communication:
Most recently we published our flagship report the Global State of Harm Reduction - this publication maps HIV and Hepatitis C epidemics among people who inject drugs and the policy and practice responses to such epidemics.  
 
https://www.hri.global/global-state-of-harm-reduction-reports
